text:
Hi,
we try to install apache 1.3.34 with mod_ssl 2.8.25 on SunOS.
We do the "configure" command for mod_ssl, then the "configure" command for 
apache (I can give you the total command if necessary).Then we run "make".

When we run "make" we got the error :

gcc -c  -I./os/unix -I./include   -DSOLARIS2=280 -DMOD_SSL=208125 -DEAPI -
DUSE_EXPAT -I./lib/expat-lite `./apaci` modules.c
gcc -c  -I./os/unix -I./include   -DSOLARIS2=280 -DMOD_SSL=208125 -DEAPI -
DUSE_EXPAT -I./lib/expat-lite `./apaci` buildmark.c
gcc  -DSOLARIS2=280 -DMOD_SSL=208125 -DEAPI -DUSE_EXPAT -I./lib/expat-lite 
`./apaci` -L/usr/local/ssl/lib   \
      -o httpd buildmark.o modules.o  modules/ssl/libssl.a  
modules/standard/libstandard.a  main/libmain.a  ./os/unix/libos.a  ap/libap.a  
lib/expat-lite/libexpat.a  -lsocket -lnsl -lpthread  -lssl -lcrypto -ldl
Undefined                       first referenced
 symbol                             in file
X509_STORE_CTX_set_depth            modules/ssl/libssl.a(ssl_engine_kernel.o)
ld: fatal: Symbol referencing errors. No output written to httpd
collect2: ld returned 1 exit status
*** Error code 1
make: Fatal error: Command failed for target `target_static'
Current working directory /opt/tmp/apache_1.3.34/src
*** Error code 1
make: Fatal error: Command failed for target `build-std'
Current working directory /opt/tmp/apache_1.3.34
*** Error code 1
make: Fatal error: Command failed for target `build'

We are not expert.. this message means that X509_STORE_CTX_set_depth is not 
correctly defined ? We don't understand what's to be done.. 
Perhaps a bug ? Or a compilation option to change ??

Thanks in advance for help.
Regards, Catherine Vallin.
creator: catherine.vallin@laposte.net

text:
This is a problem with mod_ssl/openssl compilation.  Since we do not distribute
mod_ssl for apache 1.3, we can't help with that.  You'll need to contact the
mod_ssl team.  (Or you can try httpd version 2, which comes with mod_ssl.)

Thanks for using Apache.
creator: slive@apache.org
